intro: Paragrewia poilanei, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
